item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (508 points | 182 comments)
2. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (87 points | 26 comments)
3. Big LLMs weights are a piece of history (138 points | 83 comments)
4. Edgar Allan Poe's life was a mess. But his work was in his command (33 points | 20 comments)
5. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (7 points | discuss)
6. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate E2E UI tests ( | hide)
7. Raytracing on Intel's Arc B580 – By Chester Lam (41 points | 16 comments)
8. Peru's Great Urban Experiment (2023) (24 points | 1 comment)
9. A Princely Ploy: Inside the Ruse of a French-Armenian Scammer (13 points | discuss)
10. Comet open source remote KVM from GL-iNet (23 points | 8 comments)
11. Show HN: My high school team’s space probe (107 points | 22 comments)
12. Styling an HTML dialog modal to take the full height of the viewport (32 points | 30 comments)
13. High-performance computing, with much less code (54 points | 6 comments)
14. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (458 points | 116 comments)
15. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (244 points | 78 comments)
16. Hours in a Hurricane, on a Race with No Course (6 points | 2 comments)
17. City simulator I made in Scratch (113 points | 9 comments)
18. Male octopus injects female with venom during sex to avoid being eaten (66 points | 50 comments)
19. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (282 points | 111 comments)
20. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (47 points | 9 comments)
21. Implications of Global Privacy Control (47 points | 31 comments)
22. Milk Kanban (405 points | 154 comments)
23. The British Nationality Act as a Prolog Program (1986) [pdf] (22 points | 5 comments)
24. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (192 points | 13 comments)
25. Toni Morrison's Lost Play (14 points | 1 comment)
26. A powerful free and open source WAF – UUSEC WAF (7 points | 2 comments)
27. How many artists' careers did the Beatles kill? (200 points | 184 comments)
28. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (294 points | 197 comments)
29. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (119 points | 66 comments)
30. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (138 points | 77 comments)
